title: Hating lockdown? A third of Brits have actually enjoyed it
description: A third of British people have enjoyed coronavirus lockdown, according to a massive study that tracked the emotions of more than 70,000 people in the last 14 weeks.

title: Seattle's KeyArena is being renamed Climate Pledge Arena
description: KeyArena in Seattle is going green and getting a new name.

title: Trump calls out reporter on face mask
description: As Covid-19 cases spike in the US, President Trump is trying to change the subject. CNN's Jim Acosta reports.

title: A tellecom giant is pulling its advertising from Facebook
description: Telecom giant Verizon said Thursday it is pulling its advertising from Facebook, in what may be the biggest brand yet to join the #StopHateForProfit boycott.

title: Danish PM postpones wedding to attend Covid-19 meeting
description: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen has postponed her wedding to attend the European Council meeting next month, she said in an Instagram post on Thursday.

title: CNN analyst on New York Times poll: This is huge
description: A New York Times poll looking at six key battleground states found that former Vice President Joe Biden is leading President Donald Trump by double-digits in some of those states. CNN's Harry Enten explains.

title: This 'vampire fish' is spawning in Vermont's waters
description: The sea lamprey, an eel-like creature colloquially referred to as the "vampire fish" by some publications, provides benefits that outweigh its bite, says Vermont Fish & Wildlife.

title: A new face of the Democratic Party emerges
Men arrested for allegedly selling babies on Instagram
description: Iranian authorities have arrested three men attempting to sell babies online, semi-official ISNA news agency reported Thursday.

title: CDC reveals a 'stunning' new statistic
description: CNN senior medical correspondent Elizabeth Cohen discusses the latest CDC finding saying there are 10 undiagnosed cases of coronavirus for every reported case.

title: Former UK PM: We need new organization for pandemic readiness
description: CNN's Kim Brunhuber speaks with British former Prime Minister David Cameron, who says the world needs a new international organization to scan for emerging viruses.

title: 2023 Women's World Cup hosts chosen
description: Australia and New Zealand will co-host the 2023 Women's World Cup after a vote by world football's governing body.

title: Giant wombat-like creatures, the size of black bears, once walked the earth
description: A wombat-like creature, the size of a black bear and weighing 330 pounds, roamed the earth some 25 million years ago, scientists have discovered.

title: Almost 1 in 3 pilots in this country have fake licenses, aviation minister says
description: More than 30% of civilian pilots in Pakistan have fake licenses and are not qualified to fly, the country's aviation minister revealed Wednesday.

title: What's behind California's massive surge in cases
description: California, the most populous US state and the first to implement a statewide lockdown to combat the coronavirus outbreak, is setting daily records this week for new cases as officials urge caution and dangle enforcement threats to try to curb the spikes.

title: Nasa releases stunning 10-year timelapse of the sun
description: NASA has released a 10-year timelapse of the sun by capturing 425 million high-resolution images.

title: Biologist says young people are fueling America's pandemic
description: University of Massachusetts Dartmouth Biology Professor Erin Bromage tells CNN's John Berman that coronavirus infection rates in young people are on the rise, and he believes they are fueling the pandemic.

title: What it was like to work with Anthony Bourdain in Thailand
description: When crew from CNN's "Anthony Bourdain: Parts Unknown" contacted me in February 2014 to ask for assistance with an upcoming shoot in Thailand, of course I agreed without hesitation.

title: Comedian says he regrets having mostly white male staff on show
description: Comedian Jon Stewart admits his late-night show "The Daily show" didn't do enough to address diversity and regrets having a mostly white male staff.

title: 'Apocalyptic' coronavirus surges feared in major cities as most populous states hit record numbers
description: The three most populous states are setting records for new coronavirus cases daily -- and an expert fears major Texas cities could see "apocalyptic" numbers if the trend continues.

title: Wirecard files for insolvency after ex-CEO arrested in $2 billion scandal
description: Wirecard has filed for insolvency, just days after a $2 billion accounting scandal at the company burst into the open, crashing its stock and leading to the arrest of its former chief executive.

title: The world's most powerful nation lacks a coherent strategy to meet the cresting viral crisis
description: It's a "public health train wreck in slow motion," in the words of one health expert, and the best President Donald Trump cares to offer the thousands more Americans projected to shortly die of Covid-19 is the unsubstantiated prospect of a "beautiful surprise."

title: The Eiffel tower opens today. This is what post-lockdown Paris looks like.
description: A garden pail filled with disposable hand wipes and huge bottles of hand sanitizer can be found atop every table at Paris bistro Chez L'Ami Jean.

title: Fancy a peek from the top of Eiffel Tower? You'll need to earn it
description: CNN's Cyril Vanier visits the Eiffel Tower in Paris as it reopens following its longest period of closure since WWII as the French capital emerges from lockdown.

title: Polls in Wisconsin and Ohio bring good news for Joe Biden
3 men indicted in death of Ahmaud Arbery
description: The three men accused in the February 23 shooting death of Ahmaud Arbery were indicted Wednesday by a grand jury, a district attorney said.

title: Polls in Wisconsin and Ohio bring good news for Joe Biden
description:
• Republicans aghast as Trump's divisive strategy sinks poll numbers
• Analysis: The 50 most shocking lines from Trump's wild Arizona speech

title: Belgium's King Leopold II has a 21st century nemesis. He's 14 years old.
description: Noah, a slight teenager wearing jeans and sneakers, is dwarfed by the bronze statue of Belgium's King Leopold II astride a horse. The statue, set high on a concrete plinth, has stood opposite the Royal Palace in Brussels since 1926.

title: 'Maskne': Why your face is breaking out under your mask and how to stop it
description: If you're serious about protecting yourself — and others — from the very real dangers of Covid-19, you're wearing a mask when you go out around others.

title: Anxious or reserved? You might've been that way as a baby
description: If you're reserved and anxious or depressed, you might want to call your mom and ask her what you were like as a baby.

title: Trump administration prepares major effort to protect monuments
Qantas is cutting 6,000 jobs as the coronavirus pandemic takes its toll
description: Qantas is cutting 6,000 jobs and looking to raise up to 1.9 billion Australian dollars ($1.3 billion) as the carrier fights to survive the coronavirus pandemic.

title: NASA will name its headquarters after the agency's first African American female engineer
description: NASA is renaming its headquarters after Mary W. Jackson, the agency's first African American female engineer who helped inspire the story behind the book and film "Hidden Figures."

title: Trump doesn't seem to care about America's unfolding tragedy
Photographer remembered for harrowing images of the Cultural Revolution
description: Tributes are flooding in for photographer Li Zhensheng, who documented the violent and tumultuous years of China's Cultural Revolution in the '60s and '70s.

title: Get better sleep by cuddling up with your partner
description: Need another reason to spoon with your partner at night? A new study has found that it helps with quality sleep.

title: Wrongful death suit filed over death of 'ER' actress
description: The mother of "ER" actress Vanessa Marquez has filed a wrongful death suit against officers with the City of South Pasadena, according to documents obtained by CNN.

title: One person has died and 465 people have gotten sick after interacting with pet poultry
description: One person has died and 86 have been put into the hospital in the latest outbreak of salmonella connected to pet poultry, the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention reported Wednesday.

title: Pride during a pandemic: Why visibility and connection still matter
description: Each year, in cities around the world, LGBTQ community members and their allies take to the streets to celebrate Pride -- uniting around the movement's message of self-acceptance and inclusion.

title: Korean War: 6 things you may not know
Anderson Cooper mocks Kellyanne Conway's defense of Trump's racist remark
description: Counselor to the President Kellyanne Conway comes to President Donald Trump's defense after he's repeatedly used racist rhetoric when referring to the coronavirus.
